content: The Act may be cited as the "Premier Certified Lenders Program Improvement Act of 2002". The Premier Certified Lenders Program (PCLP) has successfully helped small businesses expand. Increasing the number of premier certified lenders will provide more resources to small businesses. However, the PCLP requires lenders to set aside large amounts in loss reserve accounts. The Premier Certified Lenders Program (PCLP) has helped small businesses expand by providing resources. However, requiring premier certified lenders to maintain unnecessarily large loss reserve accounts limits their ability to serve more small businesses and new lenders to join the program. Premier certified lenders should maintain loss reserve accounts based on the risk associated with the PCLP loan portfolio. Premier certified lenders should maintain loss reserve accounts based on the risk associated with the PCLP loan portfolio to improve program efficiency and help small businesses create economic development. Premier certified lenders are required to maintain loss reserve accounts for PCLP loans to enhance program efficiency and support economic development.
